revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Jason Mantzoukas | image = Jason Mantzoukas performing at UCB.jpg | caption = Mantzoukas in January 2013 | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1972|12|18}} | birth_place = [[Nahant, Massachusetts]], U.S. | alma_mater = [[Middlebury College]] | occupation = Actor, comedian, writer | years_active = 1998{{endash}}present }} '''Jason Mantzoukas''' ({{IPAc-en|m|æ|n|ˈ|z|uː|k|ə|s}}; born December 18, 1972) is an [[United States|American]] comedic actor best known for his recurring role as Rafi in the [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] comedy series ''[[The League]]'' and as Nadal in ''[[The Dictator (2012 film)|The Dictator]]''. Mantzoukas has appeared in such films as ''[[Sleeping with Other People]]'', ''[[They Came Together]]'', and ''[[Conception (film)|Conception]]''. He had a recurring role on ''[[Parks and Recreation]]'' as Dennis Feinstein and has appeared on ''[[Brooklyn Nine-Nine]]'' as Adrian Pimento and on ''[[The Good Place]]'' as Derek Hoffstetler. He also co-hosts the popular film discussion podcast ''[[How Did This Get Made?]]'' alongside [[Paul Scheer]] and [[June Diane Raphael]]. ==Early life and education== Mantzoukas was born in [[Nahant, Massachusetts|Nahant]], the son of Cynthia (née Mourousas) and William Mantzoukas.{{cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/jason-mantzoukas/bio/673037/|title=Jason Mantzoukas Biography|website=[[TV Guide]]}} He has described himself as being of "100 percent [[Greeks|Greek]]" descent.{{cite web|last=Jones|first=Patty|url=https://www.straight.com/article-679936/vancouver/dictator-wields-comic-arsenal|title=The Dictator wields a comic arsenal|website=[[The Georgia Straight]]|date=May 9, 2012|accessdate=October 12, 2013}} Mantzoukas was an accomplished drummer during his time at Swampscott High School, anchoring a band named Slygoul. He attended [[Middlebury College]] in [[Middlebury, Vermont]].{{cite web|url=http://www.middlebury.edu/giving/difference/toolkit/Arts|title=Arts {{!}} Middlebury|website=[[Middlebury College]]|accessdate=August 2, 2016}} Mantzoukas lived in the Middle East for a few years after graduation, studying musicology.{{cite web|last=Rottenberg|first=Jason|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2012/05/18/dictators-jason-mantzoukas|title='The Dictator''s Jason Mantzoukas|date=May 18, 2012|website=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|accessdate=August 2, 2016}} ==Career== Mantzoukas began performing improvisational comedy while attending [[Middlebury College]] as a part of the Otter Nonsense Players. After college, Mantzoukas studied music and lived abroad for several years, traveling to North Africa and the Middle East. After moving to New York in 1998, he began performing comedy regularly at the [[Upright Citizens Brigade Theater]] (UCBT), where he was a member of the improv team "Mother", one of the UCBT's earliest house teams. He continues to perform in the weekly show "Soundtrack", an improvised show based on iPod playlists from audience members.{{cite web|url=http://www.jesterjournal.com/IntMantzoukas.htm|title=The Jester Interview: Jason Mantzoukas|last=Shashoua|first=Michael|website=The Jester Journal}} Mantzoukas continues to perform and teach at the [[Upright Citizens Brigade Theater]] in Los Angeles. Mantzoukas has appeared in movies such as ''[[Baby Mama (film)|Baby Mama]]'', ''[[I Hate Valentine's Day]]'', and ''[[The Dictator (2012 film)|The Dictator]]'' and has made guest appearances in comedy programs such as ''[[The Life & Times of Tim]]'', ''[[Parks and Recreation]]'', ''[[Enlightened (TV series)|Enlightened]]'', ''[[Broad City]]'', ''[[Kroll Show]]'', ''[[Modern Family]]'', ''[[The Good Place]]'', and ''[[Brooklyn Nine-Nine]]''. He currently co-hosts the [[Earwolf]] podcast ''[[How Did This Get Made?]]'' with [[Paul Scheer]] and [[June Diane Raphael]]. Although he is often cast as characters of [[Middle Eastern]] ethnicity, Mantzoukas is of Greek descent.{{cite web|last=Jones|first=Patty|url=https://www.straight.com/article-679936/vancouver/dictator-wields-comic-arsenal|title=The Dictator wields a comic arsenal|website=Straight.com|date=May 10, 2012|accessdate=May 30, 2012}} Mantzoukas and comedian Ed Herbstman performed as comedy duo "The Mantzoukas Brothers" for a number of years, and they were named "Best Improv Duo" by ''[[Time Out New York]]'' magazine in 2006.{{cite web|url=http://bestnewyorkcomedy.com/tag/the-mantzoukas-brothers/|title=The Mantzoukas Brothers|website=Best New York Comedy|accessdate=October 12, 2013}} Mantzoukas appeared in the recurring roles of Rafi on the [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] comedy ''[[The League]]'' and Eagle Wing in the "Gigolo House" sketches on [[Comedy Central]]'s sketch series ''[[Kroll Show]]''. Mantzoukas co-wrote the screenplay for the 2014 [[Ice Cube]] and [[Kevin Hart]] comedy ''[[Ride Along (film)|Ride Along]]''. He has also served as a consulting writer and producer on comedy programs such as ''[[Childrens Hospital]]'' and ''[[Portlandia (TV series)|Portlandia]]''.{{cite web|url=http://sfsketchfest.com/x/performers/jason-mantzoukas/|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140226190100/http://sfsketchfest.com/x/performers/jason-mantzoukas/|title=Jason Mantzoukas|website=[[SF Sketchfest]]|year=2012|archivedate=February 26, 2014}} Since 2018, he has replaced [[T.J. Miller]] as the voice of Mr. Mucus for the [[Mucinex]] commercials. He recently began doing live readings of movie monologues at live ''[[How Did This Get Made?]]'' podcast recordings for fans if they bring him scripts. ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !
